  10. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ] חרם סתם ולא אפילו על ידי גלגול ועל מנת אן ליס לולדי משה דנן יעארצני לא פי ביע ולא פי שרי ולא
  11. פי. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ] . . . .ת אן לא יתצרף [בה] משה דנן אלא באדני ומדה הדה אלשרכה אלי אן יקום לנא אגמע רוס אמואלנא
  12. . . . . . . ] . אלנהאיה בעד אן יחצל לנא ראס מאלנא לא נלזם בעצנא אן יביע אלדכאן ויחצל תמנהא עין אלא נתקאסם כל חאגה נצפין באלסויה
  13. . . . . ] אתאת אלדכאן נתקאסמה איצא נצפין באלסויה וגמיע דלך בעד אלערס ונפקתה ויקום לנא גמיעא רוס אמו[אלנא וקבל
  14. עלי דוחה משה הלוי דנן גמיע הדה אלשרוט מראש ועד סוף בעד אן אוקרי עליה ועלם גמיע מקתצאה ואן לא . . . . . . [ . . . .
  15. שי מן הדה אלשרכה וכדלך איצא קבלא עלי אנפסהמא גמיעא מעכשו אמונת שמים אן יחרצא ויגתהדא ולא יכאן
  16. אחדהמא שריכה ולא אפילו שוי פרוטה אד המא פי דלך כאלגרבה ואמונת שמים לאזמה להמא גמיע פאתפק עלי[ה
  17. כל מנהמא לא יתהאון פי הדה אלשרכה וקבלא עלי אנפסהמא אחריות גמיע דלך עליהמא ועלי וראתהמא בעדהמא
  18. דלא כאסמכתא דולא כטופסי דשטרי אלא כחומר וכחוזק כל שטארי דב[י] דינא דעבידין בתקנתא דרבנן ונהגין בעלמא
  19. מיומא דנן ולעלם ובביטול כל מודעין ותנאין בכל לשאני דאמור רבנן דמבטלין בהון מודעין ותנאיין סוי מא תקדם דכרה
  20. וקנינא מן כל חד מנהון לחבריה על כל מאי דכתיב ומפרש //לעילא// בתרי נסחי במאנא דכשר למקניא ביה שריר וקיים וכתבנא בתרי
  21. נסחי ויהבנא לכל חד מנהון נסחא חדא למהוי בידיה לזכו ולראיה דתלי: מן [[ו]] ואחד: ואלזיתין: לעילא קימין ודי קיומהון: דעל מחקא: . . . . . [ . . . ]קמ. . . .

body.label: T-S 12.464
body.value:
1. [Testimony which wa]s before us—we, the witnesses whose signature is found below on this doc[ument. On …] of the [w]eek,
  2. […] of the month of […]r, of the year one thousand four hundred and three years according to the count to which we are accustom[ed,] in Fus[ṭāṭ] Egypt,
  3. [situated on the Nile River.] Thus: Mr. Ṣedaqa ha-Levi b. Moses (who) r(ests in) E(den) and Mr. […] his son came before us, and [sa]id, “By God, testify
  4. [on our behalf] using all the appropriate legal formulae and the expressions of certainty, and all the language of claims, write and sign
  5. [in order that there would be a title of right and pr]oof. This (was done) in accordance with (free) will, not under duress nor under force nor any of the like from all the factors which invalidate testimony,
  6. [that we attest before you that we] have sought the guidance of God, may his Name be exalted, and we concluded a partnership (shirka) between us in an apothecary-shop … […] this Ṣedaqa from
  7. […] my son, this Moses, also [b]rought out from his own assets […] and six dinars, which came to me, and he had se[v]e[n]ty-two dinars
  8. [...] and its assaying, it was in our hands, helping in the shop … whatever the Heavens bestow (upon us) in mercy, after returning the capital
  9. […o]n the condition that I will be entitled to three dirhams as maintenance every day, for the length of our partnership (shirka), from common funds, and my son
  10. […] a dirham and a half of silver, and […] and my apartment and the good linseed oil and the
  11. […] that which is taken //from// the shop […] … […]
  12. […] other, I, Ṣe[daqa…] and I have …[…] from the shop […]
  13. [… wh]ich will accrue to me, and he will receive […] a single share of the profits, and all […]
  14. […he] will buy to furnish his house […] he is entitled to the share which is his, and during the days of (his) wedding, we will worry
  15. […] and a dirham and a half. We acknowledge […] one of us. As for the maintenance of the groom, that which was bestowed upon h[im] as maintenance
  16. […] aforementioned, something of that […] in terms of food and drink, and a gift and wedding-arrangements
  17. […] … […] something else I might buy from common funds, all that will be reckoned separately, not
  18. […] one, upon me—I, Ṣedaqa—on the condition […] in all … in the wedding
  19. […] reckoning, and he will add these two thirds from maintenance … that …
  20. […] … as the reckoning of the three dirhams […] and the dirh[am and a ha]lf, and that which he received
  21. […] and if our situation is … unprofitable, then
  22. […] a third from the previous reckoning, and the thir[d] … […]
  23. […] and we will work until he will receives the capital […]
  24. […] this Ṣedaqa and my son, this Moses
  25. […] half […]

body.label: T-S 16.168
body.value:
1. […] … […]
  2. […] calculated and … […]
  3. […] one of us in this […]
  4. […cap]ital in which we were both obligated that […]
  5. […] the //olives// something after (paying for) the wedding will be (divided) between us […]
  6. […] the ... from that which he spent on the wedding was t[hat …]
  7. […] not even a single dirham, and no profit, and no [ …] thirty-[th]ree dinars […]
  8. […] or less than that will be effective immediately for the partnership and [...]of them for this […]
  9. […] … […] and on the condition that I will be considered trustworthy as two proper witnesses concerning everything for which I have the right of disposal, and […] I am not obligated in […]
  10. […] ḥerem setam, nor even rider oaths, on the condition that my son, this Moses, may not oppose me either in selling or in purchasing, or
  11. [in …] and on the condition that that this Moses will only transact with my permission. The term of this partnership (shirka) is until we will have recouped all our capital
  12. […] the end after we receive our capital, none of us will be obligated to sell the shop and to collect its price in specie, rather we will divide each item exactly into two halves
  13. […] shop fixtures we will also divide into two halves, exactly, all this after the wedding and its expenses, and all our capi[tal.]
  14. This Moses ha-Levi, [took] upon himself all the conditions, from beginning to end; after being read to him, he understood everything it demands. If not […]
  15.  something from this partnership (shirka). Likewise also, the two of them took upon themselves faith in the heavens effective immediately, that they should both strive and struggle and
  16. neither of them would have a(nother) partnership, even to the extent of a farthing, since the two of them are away from home, and both need faith in the heavens. They agreed t[o it,]
  17. each of the two of them, not taking this partnership (shirka) lightly, the two of them taking upon themselves total responsibility, upon the two of them and upon their heirs after them
  18. (for this) is not like promises and not like formularies, but rather (bears) the weight and force of all legal documents of the cour[t], enacted with the authority of the Sages and universally followed
  19. from this day forward, nullifying all secret dispositions and conditions in any language that the Sages have employed to nullify secret dispositions and conditions except for the aforementioned conditions.
  20. We effected a qinyan with each and with his fellow concerning everything written and explicated //above,// (written) in duplicate, with an item suitable for doing so. Proper and enduring. We wrote in
  21. duplicate, and gave each of them a copy in order that he would have in his hand a title of right and proof. Hanging (between the lines): “from one” : “and the olives” : “the above” Thi[s] is enduring and this is its confirmation : Written on an erasure […]
